meanings.definition: To mark (mail) with a preprinted stamp before mailing.
meanings.sent1: I will prefrank the letters before sending them out.
meanings.sent2: Remember to prefrank the envelopes with the stamp.
meanings.sent3: The post office prefranked all the packages for faster delivery.
meanings.sent4: She prefranked her passport with the necessary visa stamps.
meanings.sent5: Prefranking the documents ensures they reach their destination on time.

meanings.definition: A stamp that has been preprinted with a design or denomination.
meanings.sent1: The collector added a rare prefrank to their stamp collection.
meanings.sent2: The prefrank on the envelope featured a beautiful floral design.
meanings.sent3: I found an old prefrank in my grandfather's desk drawer.
meanings.sent4: The prefrank on the letter was a miniature work of art.
meanings.sent5: The prefrank on the package made it stand out among the rest.
